ai-ud5.10:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud5.10:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Cūḷapanthaka was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight, and mindfulness established right there.
ai-ud5.10:2.1_0: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ai-ud5.10:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud5.10:4.3_0: a mendicant focusing on this mindfulness
ai-ud5.10:4.5_0: And when they have done so,
ai-ud5.10:4.6_0: they vanish from the King of Death.”
ai-ud5.10:4.8_0: The fifth sub-chapter on Soṇa is finished.
